content: Hi I want to make a bevy Component with f32x4 and was wondering if this type is safe to use with threads like is specified in the Send and Sync trait, if so maybe it is a good idea to add it to the f32x interface?
because of Send and Sync being auto traits, they're implemented for Simd<T, N> whenever T is Send and/or Sync
Yeah, where did you check for the implementation of Send/Sync?
Oh even better, I just tried in with bevy but it did not become a Component automatically, I must have overlooked something else. At any rate thx for your help.

Werner Laurensse said:

Oh even better, I just tried in with bevy but it did not become a Component automatically, I must have overlooked something else. At any rate thx for your help.

In order to use it as a Component you will need to describe your own wrapper type for it..
If it is JUST an f32x4, you use a 1-field tuple struct and annotate it with #[repr(transparent)], and then you can use #[derive(Component)].
